dynamic_line: I ain't seen you here before.  New?

responses.text: Yes, I'm new.  Nice to meet you.
Hate to run, but I gotta go.  See ya.

dynamic_line: Don't expect a flowery time, then.  Life can be hard, tough, and full of blood and shit.  If you can't handle that, then you're out on your ass.  Got it?
I've got paperwork to do, let's make it snappy.

responses.text: Anything that you need done around here?
Who exactly are you guys anyway?
What do you do these days?
Could you loan a poor soul any supplies?
Would you like to buy anything?

dynamic_line: Some people call us thieves, others scum, the <swear> government calls us the Hell's Raiders.  We're just some folks doin' what we need to survive is all.

responses.text: How'd you get to be called the "Hell's Raiders"?
What do you do these days?

dynamic_line: Surely you've heard of the old biker gang, the Hell's Angels?  A few of our head honchos used to run with 'em, so they named us based off that.  I know a guy who could hook you up with a bike, too.  For a price.

responses.text: What do you do these days?

dynamic_line: I'm the head honcho of this joint.  If anyone's got a problem, they answer to me.  Most days, I just make sure everything runs smoothly and that nobody dies.

responses.text: Who exactly are you guys anyway?
How'd you come to lead this organization?

dynamic_line: I'm not the top of the organization, but I topped this joint when the old guy got smashed through a wall by one of those <swear> <zombie>s, had arms as big as trashcans.  He'd wrote me down in his will as the inheritor of the position, so I took it.

I answer to the underboss, got somethin' like 20 capos under him; all of who run operations in a local district.  The underbosses go to the boss, who oversees all the territory and wealth in their region.  That boss is part of a delegate board who run our whole thing, the whole show.  The capos manage the soldiers who do most of the footwork, but I go out a bit too.  We then manage any slaves we got in our possession, sometimes sell 'em to other gangs.  They do all the menial labor like cleaning, farming, etc.
Do you live under a <swear> rock?  Yeah, we keep slaves.  I'd be glad you didn't wind up one before you found us.

responses.text: Is that really a good thing to do?

dynamic_line: Why the hell would you be with us if it wasn't?  For too long before <the_cataclysm>, the <swear> government didn't realize how much it oppressed people like us.  The weak <name_b>s got all the good stuff, while the strong were kept back.  Now we're on top, as the natural order of things should be.  Way I see it, that's the only <swear> way to live, the way nature goes.  We've got all we want out here, unlike those other <swear> <name_b>s; food, drink, good beds, sex, you name it!  Why give this up for some <swear> morality bullshit a pompous <name_b> made up 1000 years ago?

responses.text: I'll take your word for it.

dynamic_line: Lots a' new people get into this <swear> profession and don't know which way's up.  So I get it out of the way quickly.

responses.text: A solid strategy, I'd say I'm in.
